meanings.sent1: The dirty water was infective and made everyone sick.
meanings.sent2: The doctor warned about touching infective surfaces to avoid getting sick.
meanings.sent3: The infective sneeze from the clown spread laughter instead of germs.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was infective, brightening up the room like sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The infective rumor spread through the school like wildfire.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to spread disease.
meanings.sent1: The infective mosquito carried malaria and spread it to many people.
meanings.sent2: The infective flu virus quickly spread among the students in the crowded classroom.
meanings.sent3: The infective handshake between the friends passed on more than just greetings.
meanings.sent4: His words were infective, causing worry to spread like a storm.
meanings.sent5: The infective cough echoed through the room, alarming everyone present.

meanings.sent1: The infective patient was isolated to prevent the illness from spreading.
meanings.sent2: The infective carrier unknowingly passed the disease to others.
meanings.sent3: The infective pet brought joy to the family but also shared its illness.
meanings.sent4: Her touch was infective, leaving a lasting impact on those she met.
meanings.sent5: The infective bite of the insect left a mark on the skin and in the memory.
